newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Budapest milling wheat limit-down on Chicago price.
newsitem.headline: Budapest milling wheat limit-down on Chicago price.

text.p: Hungary's milling wheat futures prices continued to fall on Wednesday as the world crop outlook was positive and the good weather in Hungary promised a substantial surplus, traders said.
"Good news about the expected crop comes from everywhere," said Antal Szoke of Agrimpex Kft. "We can drop to even lower price levels."
All milling wheat futures maturities eased, most of them by the daily limit of 400 forints.
The July maturity closed at 20,170 forints per tonne, down by 240, while most actively traded December finished at 21,350, down 400 forints.
Maize futures closed steady to lower, with July ending at 21,080 forints, unchanged, while both December and March dropped 10 to 19,410 and 21,000 forints respectively.
Maize for July 1998 closed 100 forints down at 22,900.
Some feed producers had begun to buy barley and this led to a rise for shorter maturities, while barley for December dropped 200 forints to 22,200, traders said.
Total grains futures turnover on the Budapest Commodity Exchange rose to 1,081 billion forints or 2,525 lots on Wednesday, from 592.97 million forints or 1,352 lots on Tuesday.
